subject: Politics
title: What Is Nationalism
description: Learn What Is Nationalism in one minute.

hook.text: Nationalism built nations and destroyed empires. It freed colonies â€” and fueled genocides. It cuts both ways.

buildup.text: Nationalism says a people sharing language, culture, and history deserve their own state and self-rule.

discovery.text: In the 1800s, nationalism unified Italy and Germany. In the 1900s, it dismantled colonial empires worldwide.

twist.text: Nationalism turns toxic when 'our nation' becomes 'our nation is superior.' Pride becomes supremacy.

climax.text: Both world wars were driven by nationalism. The UN was built specifically to contain its destructive power.

punchline.text: Nationalism unites and divides. It builds nations and burns them down.

quiz.question: How did nationalism contribute to both World Wars?
options: National pride escalated into supremacy and inter-state aggression
Nationalism promoted peace and cooperation between nations
Nationalism had no role in either war
